intro: Draba fuhaiensis, commonly known as the Fuhai sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau in China. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, rounded seed pods. Draba fuhaiensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to extreme environmental conditions.
